meanings.sent1: The skronk of the old car's horn startled me.
meanings.sent2: The band's music was filled with skronk and clang.
meanings.sent3: The skronk of the rusty gate made me jump.
meanings.sent4: The skronk of the broken piano keys echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The skronk of the metal grinding against metal was unbearable.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, discordant noise.
meanings.sent1: Please don't skronk the chalkboard with your nails.
meanings.sent2: The old door skronked loudly when I opened it.
meanings.sent3: The cat skronked as it tried to squeeze through the narrow gap.
meanings.sent4: The branches skronked against the window in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The car engine skronked and sputtered before finally starting.

meanings.definition: A slang term for an unattractive or unpleasant person.
meanings.sent1: I don't want to sit next to that skronk in class.
meanings.sent2: She called him a skronk after he spilled his drink on her.
meanings.sent3: The skronk at the party kept telling bad jokes.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a skronk in his old, worn-out clothes.
meanings.sent5: The movie villain was portrayed as a real skronk.
